definition: diaphragm (anatomy)/distant (socially aloof)/divided by lack of mutual comprehension/nonexpert

sentences.english: The domestic caustic soda production techniques by diaphragm method and ion-exchange membrane method at present are introduced.

sentences.english: Normal breathing is accomplished by contracting the dome-shaped diaphragm downward into a flat shape.

sentences.english: All Grado headphones have a vented diaphragm design that incorporates a large air chamber.

sentences.english: Atmospheric pressure acting on the downstream side of the diaphragm forces the diaphragm and seat up.

sentences.english: A drop-leg pipe connects the valves to the dead-headed diaphragm housing.

sentences.english: Two abaxial parietal bundles extended into the inner whorl of androecium;

sentences.english: An expansion tank has a chamber in which air is locked inside a bladder or diaphragm.

sentences.english: Clean or replace the diaphragm and lubricate the stem, if necessary.

sentences.english: The collagen in the septa is continuous with the collagen in the dermis.

definition: abbr. of 樹枝狀晶|树枝状晶[shu4 zhi1 zhuang4 jing1]
to cause a wound to close up and heal
(fig.) gulf/chasm/wide gap/(originally) the Hong Canal in Henan, which in ancient times formed the border between enemies Chu 楚 and Han 漢|汉
